summary: Quick commerce app (Blinkit-style) for hyperlocal grocery and essentials delivery in Murki Jaunpur, Uttar Pradesh. Branded as 'MurkiMart' or 'JaunpurZoom' with orange/green theme. Targets Android/iOS with Hindi/English UI, 10-15 min delivery promise, 5000+ SKUs, real-time GPS tracking, UPI/COD payments, and admin panel for local store managers.
architectural_notes: UI language: Hindi and English bilingual support
Branding: 'MurkiMart' or 'JaunpurZoom' with vibrant orange/green theme
Delivery zone: Murki Jaunpur and nearby areas (1-3 km dark store radius)
Payment integrations: UPI, Google Pay, PhonePe, COD
Order notification: WhatsApp deep-link (wa.me/917348050803) with pre-filled order summary triggered on checkout confirmation (no real SMS/backend required)
Delivery is always free (no delivery fee charged to customers)
Auto-login: persist customer phone number and address to localStorage so returning users are automatically authenticated and their address is pre-filled
known_issues: Product catalog/menu is incomplete ‚Äî only shows vegetables, eggs, and meat instead of full 5000+ SKU range across all categories

existing_features.title: Apply a vibrant orange and green visual theme across the entire app branded as 'MurkiMart'. Use bold orange (#F97316) as primary accent, deep green (#16A34A) as secondary, white backgrounds, and clean sans-serif typography. The home screen should feel energetic and trustworthy, with prominent delivery promise ('Delivery in 10-15 mins') displayed at the top. Ensure consistent color usage across all screens, buttons, badges, and navigation.

Build a Home Feed screen with: (1) an auto-scrolling carousel of promotional banners featuring Murki Jaunpur local deals, (2) a 'MurkiMart Now' section with quick-add buttons for the top 20 essentials (e.g., Milk, Bread, Eggs, Parle-G, Atta, Rice, Dal, Onions, Tomatoes, Bananas, Butter, Paneer, Curd, Biscuits, Chips, Maggi, Cooking Oil, Sugar, Salt, Tea), (3) scrollable horizontal category tiles (Fruits & Vegetables, Dairy & Breakfast, Snacks, Personal Care, Pharmacy, Household, Electronics, Pet Supplies), and (4) a 'Flash Deals' section showing time-limited offers with countdown timers.

Build a Product Catalog screen with: grid view (2 columns) of products showing product image, name, quantity/weight, MRP (struck through), discounted price, discount percentage badge, star rating (e.g., 4.2‚òÖ from 12K reviews), and an Add/quantity-selector button (+/-). Include filter controls for: price range, brand, veg/non-veg toggle, and category. Support search with autocomplete suggestions. Products should be organized into the categories defined in the home screen. Show 'Out of Stock' state for unavailable items.

Build a persistent Cart system. The cart should be accessible from a sticky bottom bar visible on all non-checkout screens, showing: item count, subtotal, savings amount, and a 'Checkout' CTA button. Cart screen should list all added items with quantity controls, individual item prices, and allow item removal. Show delivery fee logic: free delivery for orders above ‚Çπ199, otherwise ‚Çπ25-50 based on order value. Show order summary with subtotal, delivery fee, total savings, and final payable amount. Include a coupon/promo code input field.

Build a Checkout and Delivery Address screen. Show saved addresses (pre-populated with sample Murki Jaunpur addresses). Allow user to add a new address by entering: flat/house number, street/locality, landmark, and selecting from a list of Murki Jaunpur localities (e.g., Murki Bazar, Jaunpur Road, Station Area). Payment methods section should show: UPI (with mock Google Pay/PhonePe icons), Credit/Debit Card, and Cash on Delivery options. Place Order button shows order confirmation with estimated delivery time of 10-15 minutes.

Build an Order Tracking screen. Show a visual order status timeline with steps: Order Confirmed ‚Üí Being Prepared ‚Üí Picked Up by Rider ‚Üí Out for Delivery ‚Üí Delivered. Each step shows a checkmark when completed and is highlighted in orange/green. Display rider name, a mock rider avatar, estimated arrival time (countdown: e.g., 'Rider arriving in 8 mins'), and a simulated live-updating ETA that counts down over time. Show order summary (items, total) at the bottom. Include an animated delivery progress bar across the top.

Build a User Profile screen with sections for: (1) Saved Addresses list with edit/delete options, (2) Order History showing past orders with date, items, total, and order status badge, (3) Loyalty Points balance with a simple points-to-rupees display (e.g., '120 points = ‚Çπ12 off next order'), (4) Language Toggle between English and Hindi (toggle changes UI labels to Hindi for key elements), and (5) a Help & Support section with FAQ items and a 'Chat Support' button (opens a mock chat UI).

Build an Admin Panel accessible via a separate '/admin' route. The panel should include: (1) Dashboard overview with key metrics cards (Total Orders Today, Revenue Today, Active Riders, Items Out of Stock), (2) Product Management table listing all products with ability to update stock quantity and price inline, (3) Orders list with real-time status updates and ability to change order status, and (4) Analytics charts showing orders by hour (peak hours), top-selling products, and category-wise revenue breakdown. Admin panel should use the same orange/green theme but with a sidebar navigation layout.

Add app-wide bottom navigation bar with 4 tabs: Home (house icon), Categories (grid icon), Cart (cart icon with item count badge), and Profile (person icon). The active tab should be highlighted in orange. Navigation should persist across screen transitions. The cart tab badge should update in real-time as items are added/removed.
Remove the Flash Deals section from the Home page (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx). Delete or disable the FlashDeals component import and its usage so it no longer renders on the home feed.
Remove the PromotionalCarousel component from the Home page (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx). Delete or disable its import and rendering so no promotional banners are shown.

Remove discount/offer badges from the ProductCard component (frontend/src/components/catalog/ProductCard.tsx). Remove the discount percentage badge display. Keep MRP and discounted price visible if present, but remove the highlighted badge overlay (e.g., '-20% OFF' badge).

Create a Customer Login page (frontend/src/pages/Login.tsx) with two sign-in options: (1) Phone Number + OTP ‚Äî user enters a 10-digit mobile number, taps 'Send OTP', then enters a 6-digit OTP in a follow-up input (mock/simulated OTP flow, no real SMS); (2) Email + Password ‚Äî user enters email and password. Both flows should display appropriate validation errors for empty or malformed inputs. On successful login (mock), store a basic user session (name, phone/email) in a Zustand auth store and navigate to the Home page. Include a 'Continue as Guest' option that dismisses the login screen and proceeds to Home.

Create a Zustand auth store (frontend/src/lib/authStore.ts) that holds: isLoggedIn (boolean), user object (name, phone, email), login(user) action, and logout() action. Persist auth state to localStorage so it survives page reloads.

Update the Profile page (frontend/src/pages/Profile.tsx) to show a 'Login / Sign Up' prompt card when the user is not authenticated (isLoggedIn === false in authStore). Tapping it navigates to the Login page. When logged in, show the existing profile sections and add a 'Logout' button that calls authStore.logout() and redirects to the Login page.

In the Checkout page (frontend/src/pages/Checkout.tsx), remove all online payment method options ‚Äî UPI, Google Pay, PhonePe, Credit/Debit Card ‚Äî from the payment methods section. Keep only 'Cash on Delivery (COD)' as the sole payment option. Since there is only one option, it should be auto-selected by default and the payment method selection UI can be simplified to just display COD as the confirmed method.

Expand the ALL_PRODUCTS array in frontend/src/lib/products.ts to include a comprehensive product catalog covering all 8 categories: Fruits & Vegetables, Dairy & Breakfast, Snacks, Personal Care, Pharmacy, Household, Electronics, and Pet Supplies. Add at least 80‚Äì100 realistic Indian products with proper names, brands, weights/quantities, MRP, discounted prices, star ratings, review counts, veg/non-veg flags, and in-stock status. Current data is limited to only vegetables, eggs, and meat ‚Äî fill out all remaining categories fully with multiple products each (e.g., 10‚Äì15 products per category minimum).

Add a back/return navigation button to the top bar area, positioned beside the search bar (frontend/src/components/common/SearchBar.tsx or the relevant header area). The button should display a left-arrow (‚Üê) or back chevron icon and, when tapped, navigate the user to the previous page (using browser history.back() or equivalent routing logic). The button should only be visible on pages where back navigation makes sense (i.e., not on the Home page root). Ensure it is styled consistently with the MurkiMart orange/green theme and does not disrupt the existing search bar layout.

Add a customer care contact section on the Home page (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx) that prominently displays the phone number +91 73480 50803. Include a phone/call icon beside the number and a short label such as 'Call to Order' or 'Customer Care'. The number should be a clickable tel: link so users can tap to call directly on mobile. Style the component consistently with the MurkiMart orange (#F97316) and green (#16A34A) theme.

Add a prominent 'Call to Order' button in the CustomerCareContact component (frontend/src/components/home/CustomerCareContact.tsx) ‚Äî a large, full-width styled CTA button with a phone icon that triggers the tel:+917348050803 link when tapped. The button should use the MurkiMart orange (#F97316) background with white text and be clearly distinguishable as a primary action.

Wrap or enhance the CustomerCareContact section on the Home page with a highlighted banner treatment ‚Äî add a visually distinct banner-style container (e.g., gradient or solid orange/green background strip, bold headline, decorative accent) that makes the customer care number and call button stand out as a featured section among the home feed content. Update frontend/src/components/home/CustomerCareContact.tsx and/or frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx as needed.

In the CustomerCareContact component (frontend/src/components/home/CustomerCareContact.tsx), reorder the layout so the phone number (+91 73480 50803) appears at the top of the banner section, above the headline/label text and the 'Call to Order' CTA button. The number should remain a clickable tel: link and the overall banner styling (orange/green theme, bold headline, decorative accents) should be preserved.

In the Checkout page (frontend/src/pages/Checkout.tsx), after the user taps 'Place Order' and the order is successfully created, automatically open a pre-filled WhatsApp message directed to +91 73480 50803. The message should contain the full order details formatted clearly: each item with its name, quantity, and price; the delivery address; the order subtotal, delivery fee, and final total. Use the WhatsApp deep-link format: https://wa.me/917348050803?text=<urlencoded message>. Open the link in a new tab (window.open) so the order confirmation flow in the app continues uninterrupted and the user lands on the OrderConfirmation page as before.

Add an order status notification system so customers receive in-app feedback when their order status changes. After placing an order, display toast/banner notifications on the Order Tracking screen (frontend/src/pages/OrderTracking.tsx) when the order progresses to each new step: 'Being Prepared', 'Picked Up by Rider', 'Out for Delivery', and 'Delivered'. Each notification should briefly display the new status with an appropriate message (e.g., 'Your order is being prepared! üç≥') styled in the MurkiMart orange/green theme.

Update the CategoryTiles component (frontend/src/components/home/CategoryTiles.tsx) and the ProductCatalog page (frontend/src/pages/ProductCatalog.tsx) to only display the following three categories: 'Fruits & Vegetables', 'Eggs', and 'Meat'. Remove all other category tiles (Dairy & Breakfast, Snacks, Personal Care, Pharmacy, Household, Electronics, Pet Supplies) from the home feed category row and from the catalog tab navigation. The CATEGORIES array in frontend/src/lib/products.ts should also be filtered or updated to reflect only these three categories.

Customize the order status update messages displayed as toast/banner notifications on the Order Tracking screen (frontend/src/pages/OrderTracking.tsx). Update the notification messages for each status transition to be more descriptive and customer-friendly: 'Being Prepared' ‚Üí 'Your order is being prepared! üç≥ Hang tight!', 'Picked Up by Rider' ‚Üí 'Your order has been picked up! üõµ Rider is on the way!', 'Out for Delivery' ‚Üí 'Almost there! Your order is out for delivery üì¶', 'Delivered' ‚Üí 'Order delivered! Enjoy your items üéâ'. Maintain the existing MurkiMart orange/green styling on the notifications.

Add a 'Buy Now' / 'Order Now' instant order button to the ProductCard component (frontend/src/components/catalog/ProductCard.tsx). This button should appear alongside the existing Add-to-cart button and allow the user to immediately place an order for that single item (quantity 1) without navigating through the cart or checkout flow. On tap, it should: (1) add the item to the cart store if not already present, (2) use the first saved address from addressStore as the delivery address (or prompt the user to add one if none exists), (3) create an order via orderStore with Cash on Delivery as the payment method, (4) open the pre-filled WhatsApp deep-link (https://wa.me/917348050803?text=<urlencoded message>) in a new tab with the order details (item name, quantity, price, delivery address, total), and (5) navigate the user to the OrderConfirmation page. Style the button consistently with the MurkiMart orange (#F97316) theme ‚Äî use a compact but clearly distinct label such as 'Buy Now' with a lightning bolt icon.

Update the delivery fee logic across the entire app so that delivery is always free (‚Çπ0) regardless of order value. Remove the tiered fee logic (‚Çπ25‚Äì‚Çπ50 for orders below ‚Çπ199). Update frontend/src/lib/cartStore.ts so the computed deliveryFee always returns 0. Update the Cart page (frontend/src/pages/Cart.tsx), Checkout page (frontend/src/pages/Checkout.tsx), and CartBottomBar component (frontend/src/components/layout/CartBottomBar.tsx) to reflect free delivery ‚Äî replace any conditional delivery fee display with a 'FREE' label or ‚Çπ0. Also update the WhatsApp order message in Checkout to show delivery fee as ‚Çπ0 / Free.

In the Checkout page (frontend/src/pages/Checkout.tsx), update the order summary section to display the product's weight or quantity descriptor (e.g., '500g', '1kg', '6 pcs') for each line item, sourced from the product's weightOrQuantity field. This label should appear alongside the product name so the billing summary clearly conveys the unit being purchased.

Create a first-visit onboarding flow that is shown automatically when a new user opens the app (i.e., no session exists in authStore). Display a modal/bottom-sheet that asks the user to enter: (1) their 10-digit mobile phone number and (2) their delivery address (flat/house number, street/locality, landmark, and locality selector with Murki Jaunpur areas). Both fields are required. On submission, save the phone number and a generated guest name (e.g., 'Customer') into authStore (marking isLoggedIn = true), and save the entered address into addressStore as the selected address. After saving, dismiss the modal and let the user continue to the Home page. Do NOT show this modal if the user is already logged in (authStore.isLoggedIn === true).

Update authStore (frontend/src/lib/authStore.ts) to ensure the persisted state includes the user's phone number and that the auto-login logic is robust: if a valid user object with a phone number already exists in localStorage (isLoggedIn === true), the app should treat the user as authenticated immediately on load without any re-prompt. No additional login step should be required on return visits.

Update addressStore (frontend/src/lib/addressStore.ts) to persist the address list to localStorage so that addresses entered during the onboarding flow or in the Checkout/Profile pages are remembered across page reloads and return visits. On rehydration, the previously selected address should remain selected.

Add a profile/account summary section at the bottom of the Home page (frontend/src/pages/Home.tsx). The section should display: (1) the logged-in user's name and phone number sourced from authStore, or a 'Login / Sign Up' prompt if not authenticated; (2) a row of quick-link cards/buttons for 'My Orders', 'Saved Addresses', 'Loyalty Points', and 'Help & Support' ‚Äî each tapping navigates to the Profile page (or the relevant section); (3) a 'View Full Profile' or 'Go to Profile' button that navigates to the Profile page. Style the section consistently with the MurkiMart orange (#F97316) and green (#16A34A) theme, using card/tile layout with icons. Place it below the CustomerCareContact banner and above any footer padding.

Style the section consistently with the MurkiMart orange (#F97316) and green (#16A34A) theme, using card/tile layout with icons. Place it below the CustomerCareContact banner and above any footer padding.

Hyperlocal inventory with 5000+ SKUs across groceries, fresh produce, dairy, snacks, personal care, electronics, medicines, pet supplies
AI-powered search with autocomplete, Hindi voice search, filters (price, brand, veg/non-veg, expiry), personalized recommendations, flash deals
Seamless checkout with one-tap add-to-cart, dynamic pricing, coupons, UPI/Google Pay/PhonePe/COD, free delivery over ‚Çπ199
Home feed with carousel banners, Blinkit Now quick-add buttons for top 50 essentials, and category tiles
Product catalog with grid view, high-res images, MRP vs discounted prices, ratings, and quantity selector
Delivery address screen with auto-detect, pin-drop map, and saved addresses
Persistent cart bottom bar with subtotal, savings, delivery fee, and 1-tap checkout
Full-screen order tracking map with rider avatar and step-by-step status updates
User profile with saved addresses, order history, loyalty points, Hindi chat support, and language toggle
Real-time inventory sync, push notifications for order updates and abandoned cart reminders
Admin panel for local store managers to update stock and pricing; analytics dashboard for orders, popular items, peak hours
Monetization via delivery fees (‚Çπ25-50), commissions (15-20% per order), and in-app ads

Provide query functions: getAllProducts, getProductsByCategory, searchProducts(query), and getProductById.

Implement the core backend data models and actor functions for: (1) Orders ‚Äî createOrder(userId, items, addressId, paymentMethod), getOrderById(id), getUserOrders(userId), updateOrderStatus(orderId, status); (2) Users ‚Äî getOrCreateUser(id), getUserAddresses(userId), addAddress(userId, address), deleteAddress(userId, addressId); (3) Loyalty Points ‚Äî addPoints(userId, points), getPoints(userId); (4) Admin stats ‚Äî getOrderStats(), getTopProducts(), getHourlyOrderCounts(). On order placement in Checkout, automatically open a pre-filled WhatsApp message with full order details (items, quantities, address, total) directed to +91 73480 50803, so the order is sent directly to the store via WhatsApp

In billing/cart/checkout, show product weight/quantity (e.g., '500g', '1kg') instead of just the item count/number

In the Cart page (frontend/src/pages/Cart.tsx), update each cart line item to display the product's weight or quantity descriptor (e.g., '500g', '1kg', '6 pcs') sourced from the product's weightOrQuantity field, shown beneath or beside the product name.
